interface.name: zxdg_decoration_manager_v1
interface.description:
This interface allows a compositor to announce support for server-side decorations.
A window decoration is a set of window controls as deemed appropriate by the party managing them, such as user interface components used to move, resize and change a window's state.
A client can use this protocol to request being decorated by a supporting compositor.
If compositor and client do not negotiate the use of a server-side decoration using this protocol, clients continue to self-decorate as they see fit.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is experimental and backward incompatible changes may be made. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump. Backward incompatible changes are done by bumping the version number in the protocol and interface names and resetting the interface version. Once the protocol is to be declared stable, the 'z' prefix and the version number in the protocol and interface names are removed and the interface version number is reset.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroy the decoration manager. This doesn't destroy objects created with the manager.

request.name: get_toplevel_decoration

description.summary: create a new toplevel decoration object

request.description:
Create a new decoration object associated with the given toplevel.
Creating an xdg_toplevel_decoration from an xdg_toplevel which has a buffer attached or committed is a client error, and any attempts by a client to attach or manipulate a buffer prior to the first xdg_toplevel_decoration.configure event must also be treated as errors.

interface.name: zxdg_toplevel_decoration_v1

description.summary: decoration object for a toplevel surface

interface.description:
The decoration object allows the client to negotiate the rendering of the window decorations.
The client is responsible for creating an xdg_toplevel_decoration object and telling the compositor what mode it wants to use.
The compositor will deliver to the client the current mode via a configure event.
The client must use the actual mode received in the configure event.
A switch to a different mode works as follows: - The client requests a new mode via set_mode. - The compositor receives the request. - The compositor sends a configure event with the new mode. - The client receives the configure event. The client can use the new mode as soon as it receives the configure event.
The client can also request a preferred mode at any time. The compositor is free to ignore this request.
The client issues a set_mode request with the desired mode. The compositor replies with a configure event with the new mode.
The compositor is free to choose its own mode if the client has not requested one.
The compositor is free to deny the request.
The compositor must reply to a set_mode request with a configure event. The client must track the new mode.
The client may also receive a configure event at any time.
The client can use the mode interface to request a mode.

entry.name: unconfigured_buffer
entry.summary: xdg_toplevel has a buffer attached before configure

entry.name: already_constructed
entry.summary: xdg_toplevel already has a decoration object

entry.name: orphaned
entry.summary: xdg_toplevel destroyed before the decoration object

enum.name: mode
enum.description: These values describe window decoration modes.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Switch back to a mode without any server-side decorations at the next commit.

request.name: set_mode
request.description:
Set the preferred decoration mode.
The compositor will check whether the requested mode is available. If it is, the compositor will send a configure event with the requested mode. If it is not, the compositor will send a configure event with a fallback mode.
The client must follow the mode received in the configure event.

request.name: unset_mode
request.description: Unset the preferred decoration mode. The compositor will choose a mode.

event.name: configure
event.description:
The configure event asks the client to change its decoration mode. The configured state should not be applied immediately. See xdg_surface.configure for details.
A configure event can be sent at any time. The specified mode must be obeyed by the client.
